description: While the term Bass is almost invariably used in conjunction with other names (generally to indicate a stop pitched lower than usual), a few examples exist of the name by itself. Strony reports that Wurlitzer used the name for the 16' Open Diapason on both manuals and pedals. The German suffix bass indicates a stop that belongs to the pedal division. It does not (necessarily) indicate low pitch.
examplesDescription: Bass 8', Pedal; St. John's R.C. Church, Chico, California, USA; Bigelow 1979. Extension of 16' Subbass.
